{{NCAATeamFootballSeason |Year=2008 |Team=Northwestern Wildcats |Image=Northwestern N logo.gif |Conference=Big Ten Conference |Division= |ShortConference=Big Ten |BCSRank= |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=9–4 |ConfRecord=5–3 |HeadCoach=[[Pat Fitzgerald]] |OffCoach=Mick McCall |DefCoach=[[Mike Hankwitz]] |OScheme=Spread |DScheme= |StadiumArena=[[Ryan Field (stadium)|Ryan Field]] |Champion= |BowlTourney=[[2008 Alamo Bowl|Alamo Bowl]] vs. [[2008 Missouri Tigers football team|Missouri]] |BowlTourneyResult= L 30-23 }} {{2008 Big Ten football standings}} The '''2008 Northwestern Wildcats football team''' represented [[Northwestern University]] in the [[Big Ten]] during the [[2008 NCAA Division I-BS football season|2008–2009]] [[college football]] season. [[Pat Fitzgerald]], in his third season at Northwestern, was the team's head coach. The Wildcats played their homes games at [[Ryan Field (stadium)|Ryan Field]] in [[Evanston, Illinois]]. ==Previous season== The [[2007 Northwestern Wildcats football team|2007 team]] finished the season with a win-loss record of 6-6 and did not receive a bowl invitation. ==Schedule== {{CFB Schedule Start|time=|rank=|ranklink=|rankyear=2008|tv=|attend=yes}} {{CFB Schedule Entry | date =
